0: The staff was VERY ACCOMMODATING to any request I may have had from shuttle service to great restaurants

Location was terrific and the Bistro on the lobby floor was great tothe price was pretty high but I think the rates were jacked up that week for the NCA swimming championships which were held at Georgia Tech
The one good thing is a cafe that gets top marks and is within walking distance
The bar had great food too
The breakfast bar with coffee and drinks in the morning is a very great touch and the hotel had plenty of parking
The staff was excellent at the front desk and the Bristol bar
There is a cafe that serves meals and Starbucks which was nice in the morning
I did not have a car and the location was several blocks from the restaurants in Midtown
Every thing was ok but it was not have buffet breakfast which is very enjoyable for me
1: I wish there had been free breakfast
While their meeting rooms were not large they provided hot breakfast service efficiently and well for the two days we were there
There is a great place to have breakfast around the corner called the Silver Skillet
2: A little bit too far to the restaurants and bars in the area of you are walking
Breakfast Service at lobby snack bar was very slow as there were only two persons working and a large crowd
There is a pool outside which can be used to relax and the breakfast provided in the morning is very high quality and worked very hard
Little amenities small lobby like and restaurant
Breakfast is not good at all the bistro has a very small selection of items and they are very expensive
It has the normal bistro if you do not wish to go elsewhere for snack dinner breakfast
No free breakfast pay only and 22 a night to park
I ate at the bistro only three times but the food was very savory
Additionally the Bistro was out of almost everything when we attempted to have dinner there Friday night and even was out of the drinks we wanted
